data.title: 10 Best Cities in Germany for International Students in 2024
data.meta_description: Want to study in the best cities in Germany for international students? Yocket has brought to you an entire list for the best cities to study in Germany!
data.text:
Top 10 Cities in Germany for Students

After narrowing down your study abroad search to Germany, the next dilemma to strike at you is: Where exactly in Germany?

To help you make that decision, here are the best cities in Germany for international students:

Munich

Frankfurt

Berlin

Hamburg

Aachen

Bonn

Dresden

Stuttgart

Leipzig

Cologne

Let us dive deep into each of these best cities for students in Germany to pursue higher education -

1. Munich

Source: Munich.de/official

Some of the top universities in Germany to study Engineering courses are located in Munich, making it one of the best student destinations in Germany. With affordable prices and a variety of scholarship opportunities, Munich has a solid Indian and International community of students. Studying in Munich you can be assured of enjoying all the comforts of city life except the business that tags along.

Some of the best courses to study in Munich:

Computer Science Engineering.

Chemical Engineering.

Civil Engineering.

Electrical Engineering.

Mechanical Engineering.

Environmental Engineering

Distributed Software

Mechatronics

Automotive Engineering

Power Engineering

Management and technology

Renewable Energy Systems

Best Universities in Munich

Technical University of Munich

Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich

Munich University Of Applied Science

What can Students do in Munich?

If you are going to be studying in Munich, you will enjoy partying and the nightlife of the city. Munich has some of the best beer, food, and fun joints to make the most of an evening.

Apart from that, students also have easy access to many European cities to easily explore the rest of the continent. But, if you are looking for activities to do in Munich, you will still find yourself occupied with everything that Munich has to offer. You can:

Visit various historical galleries and museums

Have a brunch at the castles

Dive into the lakes around

Have a touristy time visiting the Churches, historic sites, and more

Spend a day at the BMW museum and more.

Read: Public Universities in Germany

Is it worth Studying in Munich?

It is worth studying in Munich. For Indian students, you have many Indians to help you figure out your life in Germany. Additionally, if you are interested, Munich has many job and PhD opportunities. However, remember that the level of competition at the top universities is high and so, you will have to put your best foot forward.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Munich

2. Frankfurt

Source: Frankfurt.de/official

Frankfurt is the finance capital of Germany. While the other cities of Germany are filled with greenery, Frankfurt has a perfect busy high-town vibe. The skyscrapers, the hurried stockbrokers, and the nightlife buzz make your life in Frankfurt desirable yet busy.

For aspirants planning to pursue a course in finance, economics, or business in Germany, we recommend you choose Frankfurt.

Some of the best courses to study in Frankfurt:

Finance

Economics

Liberal arts

Communication

Business Studies

Best Universities in Frankfurt

Frankfurt University of Applied Sciences

Frankfurt School of Finance & Management

Goethe University Frankfurt

Goethe Business School

The Frankfurt University of Music and Performing Arts

What can Students do in Frankfurt?

Earning the name ‘Main-hattan’ because of the shimmering skyscrapers, Frankfurt is one of the coolest student cities in Germany. We’d like to give you evidence, here are some of the amazing things you can you in Frankfurt as an international student:

Travel

Explore the city, pubs, and restaurants

Visit the Goethe House

Learn about the German culture and history

Shop

Suggested: MS in Germany

Is it worth studying in Frankfurt?

Studying in the ‘Main-hattan’ of Germany is worth it! Apart from a good education, other perks like a great student community, a well-connected commute, and a great cultural mix add to a fun and comforting experience. This is also one of the top destinations to advance your career. Since many offices are located in Frankfurt, students have a high chance of getting a good job in the city after their studies.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Frankfurt

3. Berlin

Source: Berlin.de/official

Berlin, the capital city, is one of the best cities in Germany for international students. With its diverse culture, the city and scenic mix, and exciting nightlife, Berlin has it all. Students studying here might find it fun yet moderately challenging to adapt to a town with language barriers. However, if you’re adapting to the language and the people, your study in Berlin definitely ought to be memorable. Berlin is one of the best student cities in Germany, but here's something you should know: Most of the courses are offered in German, so learn the language or be sure to choose the course in an English teaching medium.

Some of the best courses to study in Berlin:

Specialization in Renewable Energy

Courses in illustration, design, and communication

Photography

Business Management

Social Design and Sustainable Innovation

Data Analytics and Information System Management

Business Intelligence and Analytics

Best Universities in Berlin

Humboldt University of Berlin

Free University of Berlin

Berlin Institute of Technology

Berlin University Of Arts

Charite University Berlin

Berlin International University of Applied Sciences

Suggested: All About Engineering in Germany

What can Students do in Berlin?

The capital city has a lot to offer to international students. Exploring the city alone is a fascinating feeling. Reminiscing the great Berlin Wall, strolling around the Spree River of Berlin while you sip a cold coffee will certainly brighten your day. Some of the other things you can do in Berlin are:

Explore the museums of Berlin

Enjoy the nightlife

Have instant-friendly photoshoots at the East Side Gallery of Berlin

Sign up for an artsy tour across the city

Watch the sunset from the Berlin tower

Is it worth Studying in Berlin?

There is no doubt that Berlin is one of the best student cities in Germany. The amazing student life and experiences you will gather while studying in Berlin are unparalleled. The vast exposure and facilities available are certainly going to make your study in Berlin worth it. The well-connected city, the cultural richness, and the scenic town certainly account for Berlin as one of the best cities in Germany for students.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Berlin

4. Hamburg

Source : Hamburg.de/official

Hamburg has some of the most architecturally gorgeous buildings in Germany. This is the perfect student town, being one of the best destinations for Instagrammers, fashionistas, and music enthusiasts. Housing some of the top fashion brands, music museums, and more, students love living in Hamburg. The scenery and the education system are a bonus to the young energetic vibe of the town.

Some of the best courses to study in Hamburg:

Computer science

Business administration

Food Chemistry

Economics

Industrial engineering

Aeronautical

Automotive engineering

Journalism

Nanoscience

Psychology

Music and liberal arts

Best Universities in Hamburg

HFH Hamburger Fern-Hochschule

Hamburg University of Technology

Hamburg School of Business Administration

University of Fine Arts Hamburg

HafenCity University Hamburg

Hochschule für Musik und Theater Hamburg

Suggested: How to Study in Germany After the 12th?

What can Students do in Hamburg?

As a student, you will enjoy having many interesting experiences in Hamburg. Some of the things you can do in Hamburg:

Visit the various museums and parks

Spend a day at the miniature museum

Hang out at the bars of the city

Spend time at the music joints and listen to music bands

Experience the dialogue in the dark

Is it worth studying in Hamburg?

For fashion and music lovers, Hamburg is a study destination. You will certainly have a fun time hanging out and exploring the city of Hamburg. The beautiful city, the live bands, and the youthful atmosphere will serve as an amazing experience in any student's life.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Hamburg

5. Aachen

Source : Aachen.de/official

One of the overlooked or underrated places in Germany is Aachen. Yes, this might come as a surprise, but Aachen is a tech-freak town. If you’re looking to pursue an automotive career or study technology, Aachen is the best place to study in Germany for you. RWTH Aachen University is one of the top universities in Germany founded by the minds of the IDEA League, a prestigious association of all the technical universities across Europe. This means that Aachen is undoubtedly the ideal destination to study courses in engineering.

Some of the best courses to study in Aachen:

Applied Geophysics

Automotive Engineering

Biomedical Engineering

Data Science

Electrical Engineering,

Information Technology

Computer Engineering

Communications Engineering

Micro and Nanoelectronics

Media Informatics

Metallurgical Engineering

Software Systems Engineering

Sustainable Management

Best Universities in Aachen

RWTH Aachen University

FH Aachen University

What can Students do in Aachen?

Aachen is a small city. However, it is one of the best German cities for international students who live an adventurous life. And to balance that out you also have an ancient thermal bath in Aachen.

Take a hike on the Eifelsteig trail

Relax at the Carolus Therman

Visit the famous Aachen Cathedral

Have an instant-friendly shoot with the flamingos at the Aachen park

Is it worth studying in Aachen?

If you’re aspiring to study an elective course in Engineering, especially in automobile engineering or computers, the answer is a big fat yes! Studying in an affordable city with easy access to places like Belgium is a good deal for students to live economically and travel wholeheartedly.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Aachen

6. Bonn

Source : Bonn.de/official

Bonn functions as the seat of the German Government alongside Berlin. Apart from Bonn’s particular political popularity, the city is also famous for being the birthplace of the genius musical composer, Beethoven. Furthermore, Bonn is a perfect mix of modernity and culture. The historically rich is also the hub of many multinational companies. This means that international students can seek many job opportunities in Bonn.

Some of the best courses to study in Bonn:

Computer Science

Physics

Mathematics

European and Asian Art History

Paleontology

Geology

Best Universities in Bonn

University of Bonn

University of Applied Sciences for Finance, Bonn

Suggested: Bachelors in Germany

What can Students do in Bonn?

As mentioned, Bonn is a fascinating mix of history and modernity. Likewise, international students studying in Germany have the privilege of experiencing the coolness of the city as it has many tourist attractions. Students studying in Bonn must-

Visit the Bundeskunsthalle exhibition.

Take a tour of the art galleries and the historic galleries of Germany at Bonn.

Picnic and reminisce about German history at the Bonn Minster.

Visit the palaces in Bonn and also, you just can’t miss out on the Rheinisches Landesmuseum Bonn.

Is it worth studying in Bonn?

Bonn might not be your first choice, but, if you are planning to take up courses in History, Physics, Mathematics, etc, Bonn is one of the best places to study in Germany. The city will allow you to enjoy a modern yet laid-back lifestyle. If you’re keen on studying in Germany but are intimidated by the fast pace, you can then consider Bonn as your study destination.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Bonn

7. Dresden

Source : Dresden.de/official

Dresden is the most beautiful city in Germany. Also known as the ‘Jewel Box of Germany’, Dresden attracts thousands of tourists and students every year. However, beauty is not the only attractive quality of this town, Dresden is well known for its political, cultural, and highly sophisticated education system. The scenic lifestyle and good quality of education make Dresden one of the best cities to study in Germany.

Some of the best courses to study in Dresden are:

Computational Modeling and Simulation

Computational Logic

Distributed Systems Engineering

Nanoelectronic Systems

Dance

Suggested: GRE Accepting Universities in Germany

Best Universities in Dresden

Dresden University of Technology

University of Applied Sciences Dresden (HTW Dresden)

Academy of Fine Arts Dresden

Palucca University of Dance Dresden (Palucca Hochschule für Tanz Dresden)

What can Students do in Dresden?

As a student, most of your time is spent reading and spending time at various serene parks. But, with this, you also have a lot to explore in Dresden, like:

Have a historic city tour (learning all about the historic buildings)

Have a fun picnic by the Dresden Castle or the Zwinger Palace

Cruise to Prague

Visit art galleries

Hang out at the various cafes of the town.

Is it worth studying in Dresden?

Students who love an aesthetic lifestyle should consider living in Dresden. Furthermore, for students specializing in the liberal arts, history, architecture, and dance studies, Dresden is surely one of the top destinations to consider.

8. Stuttgart

Source : Stuggart.de/official

If you are a nature lover, Stuttgart is your place to be. With a good education system and a lovely lifestyle, many students prefer studying in Stuttgart. To add to the fun factor, Students studying in Stuttgart, enjoy a great deal of snowboarding, skiing, and hiking. It’s fair to say that, if you are an international student studying in Stuttgart, you are bound to have some of the best experiences of your life in Germany.

Some of the best courses to study in Stuttgart:

Architecture and Urban Planning

Aerospace Engineering and Geodesy

Civil and Environmental Engineering

Computer Science

Electrical Engineering and IT

Energy Process and bio-engineering

Engineering Design

Production Engineering

Automotive Engineering

Best Universities in Stuttgart

University of Stuttgart

Stuttgart Media University

Stuttgart Technology University of Applied Sciences

Baden-Württemberg Cooperative State University

What can Students do in Stuttgart?

Some of the exciting activities you should engage in Stuttgart are:

Visit the Mercedes-Benz Museum and arena

Go to the Porsche Museum

Spend time at the famous public library

You also can expect an exciting Christmas with the famous Stuttgart Christmas markets

Is it worth studying in Stuttgart?

Stuttgart is a slightly offbeat choice of study but yet a very exciting one. Students interested in pursuing Engineering should surely consider Stuttgart as their study destination

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Stuttgart

9. Leipzig

Source : Leipzig.de/official

The many Leipzig Churches, tourist sites, cafes, and museums sum up life in Leipzig. Like any other German town, Leipzig offers an education that attracts international students from all over the world.

Some of the best courses to study in Leipzig:

International energy economics and business administration

Small enterprise promotion and training

Physics

Global Studies

Advanced Spectroscopy in Chemistry

Suggested: MS in Germany Cost

Best Universities in Leipzig

Leipzig University

Leipzig University of Applied Sciences

University of Music and Theatre Leipzig

What can Students do in Leipzig?

Students can enjoy a lot of cultural and outdoor activities in Leipzig. Some of the cool things you can do here are:

Take an excursion to the Belantis.

Visit the famous Leipzig Zoo.

Spread out a picnic at the park.

Is it worth studying in Leipzig?

If you are someone aspiring to study in Germany but want to keep away from the competitive rush, then you should consider studying here. This can be a good place to get a quality education without the pressures of a competitive sphere.

Suggested: Top Universities to Study in Leipzig

10. Cologne

Source : Cologne.de/official

Famous for its Cathedral in Cologne, the city is a cultural hub. In addition to that, the University of Cologne is also one of the oldest and one of the top universities you can study in. As for the city, the ancient town flaunts its historic quirks and the Rhine River adds to its stunning elements.

Some of the best courses to study in Cologne:

Applied Natural Sciences

Architecture and Construction

Computer Science

Engineering

Culture; Information and Communication

Society and Social Sciences

Business Studies.

Best Universities in Cologne

University of Cologne

Cologne University of Applied Sciences

German Sport University Cologne

Cologne Business School

What can Students do in Cologne?

Cologne is popular among international students not only for education but also for a range of other activities. Some of the things students can do here are -

Visit the Nazi regime memorials

See the historic Churches in the city

Enjoy the Rhine Cruises-hosted events

Is it worth studying in Cologne?

Cologne might not be just the ideal place if you want an affordable and authentic location as a student. If you wish to pursue courses specific to the University Of Cologne you certainly will enjoy your stay in Cologne.

Suggested: IELTS Score for Germany

From the Desk of Yocket
